What It Is: Beeswax from cappings and brood comb is rendered into clean blocks for candles, cosmetics, and food wraps.
Harvesting & Processing: Melt gently in water baths; filter through cloth; settle and scrape slumgum; repeat for cosmetic grade. Keep brood comb wax separate from cappings for lighter colour.
Properties & Uses: Colour and aroma vary by forage and comb age. Purity determines suitability for cosmetics and food contact.
Market & Value: Clean, light cappings wax earns premiums. Label origin and batch for repeat buyers.
